So I hope you can appreciate what we got from 86 and don't say "oh if studio xx adapts it the fight scene will be good" because yeah there is a chance the fight scene will be good but what will happen to the other area like the song, VA, story because there is a lot of novels that got adapted to anime that turns out not as good as the novel itself so be appreciate what we got. :)

He's a war psychopath. In my opinion, now that I've caught up, I can safely say that it's most likely a Nouzen clan trait to like war to the extreme. You'll see what I mean in a while.
So nouzen clan is like the ackermans?

No, unlike the Ackermans who are co-dependent on their host and will obey any such order that their host demands; the Nouzen are war-addicts who no matter the circumstance---deep down enjoy war; thus making them war psychopaths. And naturally, if you enjoy something more than your average person, then you are bound to be better at it than others.

Yea, he is definitely a war psychopath but u can't blame him. He hears those voices every min of the day and has been fighting since he was a young child and the whole brother thing. I think he uses it as a way to relax and forget the shitty life he is in. Haven't read the Ln but I'm jus guessing from what I have seen so far in the anime.

I don't actually blame him. As a matter of fact, the subtle hint of psychosis every time is what makes me so invested into his character. He sounds really hollow and empty, but a part of him can't help but enjoy tearing the Legion apart and that's not really his fault, as you mentioned.

I'm still confused on when frederica said she released the legion to the world or something along those lines..like did she mean she was the cause of her knight becoming a legion who seems to be the leader of them all which led to this war? or she's responsible for making legion in general? Also the old man that took them in is sus..and he seems to feel guilty over something we dont know about yet..I feel like the federacy has something to do with the origins of the legion unless I'm thinking too deep on it

I'm not putting in spoiler quotes cuz everything I'm about to say is from previous episodes of this cour-
Now, first off- She is the from the imperial family of the former regime, the last survivor in fact, but before old giad fell, but after the legion were released, the people started an insurrection, which eventually succeeded, the end result being the slaughter of the royal family including their daughter supposedly. Up until that point Kiriya had always been with frederica, protecting her. so when they gave "proof" she'd been killed, kiriya had decided he no longer had anything to live or fight for since what he had spent his life protectiong had been taken from him. He stood infront of a legion and did not move a it swiped his head. She blames herself because it was the misinformation of her death that lead to his becoming part of the legion. While it was out of her control, in every aspect of the phrase, she still blames herself for everything in proper anime fashion. again all of this has been explained PRIOR TO this episode, so none of this is a spoiler.
now this part, I'm not sure about but I've been asking people whove read the novels to help explain some extra shit for me, Frederica is the LAST surviving member of the royal family, who are the only ones who can stop or start conflict with the legion. She claims she was the one who released them but given her age and time elapsed I find that hard to believe, though the thought of a psuedo government comes to mind, in which she could have just been the proxy. regardless of the actual circumstances, its easy to see how and why she would shoulder the blame. Her regime both conceptualized and launched the legion, starting this war and causing countless deaths across the world on all sides. whether or not she was the one who did it personally doesnt matter in cases like these because humans want someone to blame and pay retribution. sometimes thats yourself, other times its the ones who let it happen regardless of intention.
yoo thanks for the explanation. that makes much more sense now

Frederica is a child from the old empire which made the legion, hence she is a princess, when the legion broke out the empire where she was in was like ground 0 to where it happened, that's why her knight a legion, she felt bad and responsible for it because she believes that it's her fault that her knight became one of the legion because he protected her in order for her to escape

I dont think this is a spoiler but ill just cover it anyway. The main reason why there is few to none aircraft is because of the einstagsfliege which aside from jamming their comms, also have air superiority in numbers and could swarm fighter jets. Aircraft were deemed useless on the legion war

this was explained in the first few episodes of the first season, The legion have TWO unit times making aircraft largely inoperable. As said above, the jammer moths are designed not only to jam radio waves but also to fly into the engines of aircraft causing them to fail. also there is another unit that is specifically an anti aircraft unit that are strategically placed around the borders of legion territory. the latter were actually some of the first to be deployed when the war started according to I think it was Lena that was talking about it? again this question was answered last season in the beginning.
